definition: to boss people around (idiom)
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
roar/cry/CL:個|个[ge4]
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
surname Shi
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out
see 令狐[Ling2 hu2]
classifier for a ream of paper
see 脊令[ji2 ling2]
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: Margaret is calling the shots around our house these days.
sentences.chinese: 玛格里特这几天在我们家发号施令。

sentences.english: The victorious nations were able to dictate peace terms.
sentences.chinese: 战胜国能发号施令地规定媾和条件。
他是个爱发号施令的领导。

sentences.english: The captain bawled out the orders.
Elijah then on Mount Carmel again takes charge. His first question was to the people.
sentences.chinese: 在迦密山上，以利亚再次成为发号施令的人。

sentences.english: The goose took command and began to give orders.
sentences.chinese: 那只母鹅当起了指挥，开始发号施令。

sentences.english: For the next few hours, I am the one who commands.
sentences.chinese: 接下来的几个小时里，由我来发号施令。

sentences.english: Cadres should go deep among the masses, not just sit in their offices issuing orders.
sentences.chinese: 干部要深入群众，不要只是坐在办公室里发号施令。

sentences.english: Mr. Dempster appeared to be a man accustomed to exercise authority.
sentences.chinese: 登普斯特先生看来是一个习惯于发号施令的人。

sentences.english: He lorded it over his household.
Her father dictated and her mother obeyed.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲发号施令，她母亲惟命是听。

sentences.english: He was giving orders, and people were taking them.
sentences.chinese: 他发号施令，人们惟命是从。

definition: lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
to gesticulate while talking (idiom)/to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily
to gesticulate while talking (idiom); to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily/also written 指手畫腳|指手画脚
to follow obediently
to admonish subordinates
to dispatch/to assign/a dispatch
bowed head and ears glued (idiom); docile and obedient/at sb's beck and call
to make a decision/to make up one's mind
to issue an order
to be in a position of power
to wait for (orders, a decision, a judgment)
to order sb about/to use sb
an order (esp. army)/bugle call expressing military order/verbal command
to call to come and shout to go (idiom); to yell orders/always bossing people around
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
order/command/CL:道[dao4],個|个[ge4]
